intro: Dischisma leptostachyum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed dischisma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its slender stems and small, pale yellow flowers make it a distinctive yet understated wildflower. Dischisma leptostachyum is often found in elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters above sea level.
